alert.note: Alert for Eastern Columbia; Eastern Dutchess; Eastern Greene; Eastern Ulster; Western Columbia; Western Dutchess (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 22 at 9:56PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Ulster, Dutchess, Columbia and eastern Greene Counties through 1045 PM EDT... At 956 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near New Baltimore to Fishkill. Movement was northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Heavy rains could cause flooding. Locations impacted include... Poughkeepsie, Kingston, Beacon, New Paltz, Hudson, Catskill, Saugerties, Rhinebeck, Pawling, Chatham, Hyde Park, Milton, Plattekill, Pleasant Valley, Hurley, Claverack, Wappingers Falls, Amenia, Livingston and Copake. This includes Interstate 87 between exits 18 and 21B. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Columbia; Eastern Dutchess; Eastern Greene; Eastern Ulster; Western Columbia; Western Dutchess
